devdoc.author: AZTEC
devdoc.details: NoteUtils is a utility library that extracts user-readable information from AZTEC proof outputs.     Specifically, `bytes proofOutput` objects can be extracted from `bytes proofOutputs`,     `bytes proofOutput` and `bytes note` can be extracted into their constituent components,*

extractChallenge(bytes).details: Extract the challenge from a bytes proofOutput variable

params._proofOutput: bytes proofOutput, outputted from a proof validation smart contract

extractChallenge(bytes).return: bytes32 challenge - cryptographic variable that is part of the sigma protocol

extractNote(bytes).details: Extract constituent elements of an AZTEC note
extractNote(bytes).return: owner, Ethereum address of note ownernoteHash, the hash of the note's public keymetadata, note-specific metadata (contains public key and any extra data needed by note owner)

extractProofOutput(bytes).details: Extract constituent elements of a `bytes _proofOutput` object
extractProofOutput(bytes).return: inputNotes, AZTEC-ABI dynamic array of input AZTEC notesoutputNotes, AZTEC-ABI dynamic array of output AZTEC notespublicOwner, the Ethereum address of the owner of any public tokens involved in the proofpublicValue, the amount of public tokens involved in the proof        if (publicValue > 0), this represents a transfer of tokens from ACE to publicOwner        if (publicValue < 0), this represents a transfer of tokens from publicOwner to ACE

get(bytes,uint256).details: Get a bytes object out of a dynamic AZTEC-ABI array
get(bytes,uint256).return: number of entries in the pseudo dynamic array

getLength(bytes).details: Get the number of entries in an AZTEC-ABI array (bytes proofOutputs, bytes inputNotes, bytes outputNotes)     All 3 are rolled into a single function to eliminate 'wet' code - the implementations are identical
getLength(bytes).return: number of entries in the pseudo dynamic array

devdoc.title: NoteUtils
